credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Two putti beside a vase with flowers, part of a painted wall decoration.
medium: Pen and wash with brown ink and black chalk, on off-white paper on secondary paper support
description: The rose stands upon a pedestal behind the top of a triangular moulding. The left putto kneels, the right one sits. They carry a rope which swings from the vase.
name: Drawing
